I'll explain it using the TileView widget contribution as an example. This widget can be included easily into any qooxdoo application by using the "contrib://" protocol. So far so good. The TileView widget itself uses internally the FlowLayout contributions which forces the application developer currently to include both contributions via the "contrib://" mechanism to get it up and running,
It would be better if we find some mechanism for contributions that they can articulate their own dependencies (e.g. inside their "Manifest.json") and then pull the dependent contributions automatically into the application.

== Update == The TileView is not an example anymore since the FlowLayout is now a part of the framework. Nevertheless is this feature an important one to have. We should introduce this support to be able to use a contribution easier. So the application developer does not need to know about the dependencies the contribution has. I guess this is possible using the libary key which is already available. These issues are also remarked at Bug #3340 by Christian Boulanger.
*** Bug 3340 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Also see bug#3339, covering recursive depenencies to add-script scripts.
